page.title: 05KINGSTON ST. MARY CHURCH
page.content: The fine tower is like many in Somerset. It was built in 1490 in red sandstone. In the corners of the tower,there are ugly creatures which are called 'hunky punks'.The ground floor is used as a vestry. In the South aisle there is a huge tomb.It was built in 1380 in honour of a warrior who settled near Kingston. The church has many bench-ends made of oak,one with a weavers' shuttle and other decorations of the sixteenth century. The porch holds a statue of the Virgin Mary,and the porch was built at the same time as the tower but the statue is more recent. The nave is quite plain apart from a large chandelier in the centre. The chancel has the large east window and dates back to the early sixteenth century.
